00017 package WeBWorK::Authen::Proctor;
00018 use base qw/WeBWorK::Authen/;
00019 
00020 =head1 NAME
00021 
00022 WeBWorK::Authen::Proctor - Authenticate gateway test proctors.
00023 
00024 =cut
00025 
00026 use strict;
00027 use warnings;
00028 use WeBWorK::Debug;
00029 use WeBWorK::DB::Utils qw(grok_vsetID);
00030 
00031 use constant GENERIC_ERROR_MESSAGE => "Invalid user ID or password.";
00032 
00033 ## this is only overridden for debug logging
00034 #sub verify {
00035 #   debug("BEGIN PROCTOR VERIFY");
00036 #   my $result = $_[0]->SUPER::verify(@_[1..$#_]);
00037 #   debug("END PROCTOR VERIFY");

00040 
00041 # this is similar to the method in the base class, with these differences:
00042 #  1. no guest logins
00043 #  2. no cookie
00044 #  3. user_id/session_key/password come from params proctor_user/proctor_key/proctor_passwd
00045 sub get_credentials {
00046     my ($self) = @_;
00047     my $r = $self->{r};
00048     my $ce = $r->ce;
00049     my $db = $r->db;
00050 
00051     my $urlpath = $r->urlpath;
00052     my ($set_id, $version_id) = grok_vsetID( $urlpath->arg('setID') );
00053     
00054     # at least the user ID is available in request parameters
00055     if (defined $r->param("proctor_user")) {
00056         my $student_user_id = $r->param("effectiveUser");
00057         $self->{user_id} = $r->param("proctor_user");
00058         if ( $self->{user_id} eq $set_id ) {
00059             $self->{user_id} = "set_id:$set_id";
00060         }
00061         $self->{session_key} = $r->param("proctor_key");
00062         $self->{password} = $r->param("proctor_passwd");
00063         $self->{login_type} = $r->param("submitAnswers") 
00064             ? "proctor_grading:$student_user_id" 
00065             : "proctor_login:$student_user_id";
00066         $self->{credential_source} = "params";
00067         return 1;
00068     }
00069 }
00070 
00071 # duplicates method in superclass, adding additional check for permission 
00072 #    to proctor quizzes
00073 sub check_user {
00074     my $self = shift;
00075     my $r = $self->{r};
00076     my $ce = $r->ce;
00077     my $db = $r->db;
00078     my $authz = $r->authz;
00079 
00080     my $submitAnswers = $r->param("submitAnswers");
00081     my $user_id = $self->{user_id};
00082     my $past_proctor_id = $r->param("past_proctor_user") || $user_id;
00083 
00084     # for set-level authentication we prepended "set_id:"
00085     my $show_user_id = $user_id;
00086     $show_user_id =~ s/^set_id://;
00087 
00088     if (defined $user_id and ($user_id eq "" || $show_user_id eq "")) {
00089         $self->{log_error} = "no user id specified";
00090         $self->{error} = "You must specify a user ID.";
00091         return 0;
00092     }
00093     
00094     my $User = $db->getUser($user_id);
00095     
00096     unless ($User) {
00097         $self->{log_error} = "user unknown";
00098         $self->{error} = GENERIC_ERROR_MESSAGE;
00099         return 0;
00100     }
00101     
00102     # proctors may be tas, instructors, or proctors; if the last, they
00103     #    do not have the behavior course_access, so we don't bother to 
00104     #    check that here.  they must, however, be able to login, which 
00105     #    it seems to me is an overlap between course permissions and 
00106     #    course status behaviors.
00107 
00108     unless ($authz->hasPermissions($user_id, "login")) {
00109         $self->{log_error} = "user not permitted to login";
00110         $self->{error} = GENERIC_ERROR_MESSAGE;
00111         return 0;
00112     }
00113 
00114     if ( $submitAnswers ) {
00115         unless ($authz->hasPermissions($user_id,"proctor_quiz_grade")) {
00116             # only set the error if this proctor is different 
00117             #    than the past proctor, implying that we have
00118             #    tried to grade with a new proctor id
00119             if ( $past_proctor_id ne $user_id ) {
00120                 $self->{log_error} = "user not permitted " .
00121                     "to proctor quiz grading.";
00122                 $self->{error} = "User $show_user_id is not " .
00123                     "authorized to proctor test grade " .
00124                     "submissions in this course.";
00125             }
00126                 
00127             return 0;
00128         }
00129     } else {
00130         unless ($authz->hasPermissions($user_id,"proctor_quiz_login")) {
00131             $self->{log_error} =  "user not permitted to proctor " .
00132                 "quiz logins.";
00133             $self->{error} = "User $show_user_id is not " .
00134                 "authorized to proctor test logins in this " .
00135                 "course.";
00136             return 0;
00137         }
00138     } 
00139 }
00140 
00141 # this is similar to the method in the base class, excpet that the parameters
00142 # proctor_user, proctor_key, and proctor_passwd are used
00143 sub set_params {
00144     my $self = shift;
00145     my $r = $self->{r};
00146     
00147     $r->param("proctor_user", $self->{user_id});
00148     $r->param("proctor_key", $self->{session_key});
00149     $r->param("proctor_passwd", "");
00150 }
00151 
00152 # rewrite the userID to include both the proctor's and the student's user ID
00153 # and then call the default create_session method.
00154 sub create_session {
00155     my ($self, $userID, $newKey) = @_;
00156     
00157     return $self->SUPER::create_session($self->proctor_key_id($userID), $newKey);
00158 }
00159 
00160 # rewrite the userID to include bith the proctor's and the student's user ID
00161 # and then call the default check_session method.
00162 sub check_session {
00163     my ($self, $userID, $possibleKey, $updateTimestamp) = @_;
00164     
00165     return $self->SUPER::check_session($self->proctor_key_id($userID), $possibleKey, $updateTimestamp);
00166 }
00167 
00168 # proctor key ID rewriting helper
00169 sub proctor_key_id {
00170     my ($self, $userID, $newKey) = @_;
00171     my $r = $self->{r};
00172     
00173     my $proctor_key_id = $r->param("effectiveUser") . "," . $userID;
00174     $proctor_key_id .= ",g" if $self->{login_type} =~ /^proctor_grading/;
00175     
00176     return $proctor_key_id;
00177 }

00179 # disable cookie functionality for proctors
00180 sub maybe_send_cookie {}
00181 sub fetchCookie {}
00182 sub sendCookie {}
00183 sub killCookie {}
